post_text: At last, it's time to recognize our longest-serving active School Board Member, Mr. Dan Griffith. Dan Griffith is a lifelong resident of Owensboro. He received a BA degree from Georgetown College and an MPA from Western Kentucky University. After graduation, Griffith returned to Owensboro and served as the Executive Director of the Owensboro Symphony for thirteen seasons. In August 2017, Griffith was appointed by former Kentucky Governor Matt Bevin to serve on the governing board of Kentucky Educational Television, a PBS affiliate. In addition, he serves as a Vice President on the Friends of Kentucky Education Television Board. He currently serves on the Owensboro Health Regional Hospital's Arts in Healing Advisory Board and has served on the boards of Owensboro Health - Foundation for Health, Owensboro Symphony Orchestra Board and Foundation Board, Owensboro Dance Theatre board and the League of American Orchestra board, as a manager's group representative.

January is School Board Appreciation Month, so throughout the month, we will be sharing information about our School Board members who do so much for our district. First up, a newcomer to the OPS School Board, Mr. Michael Johnson.

Mr. Johnson is entering his second year on the school board. He is a retired Navy Chief, an independent gospel artist and an ordained minister. Mr. Johnson is a leader in several other organizations in addition to the School Board. He is President of Truth Outreach Inc., a nonprofit charity organization that helps homeless, low income families and Senior citizens in our community. He also serves as a board member of Audubon Area Community Care Clinic. He is also a member of My Brothers Keeper an organization that advocates for the Youth for a better future.

When asked why he wanted to join the School Board, Johnson said, "I am dedicated to service to others above all else, when I returned home from overseas, I wanted to make a difference in my community. I am blessed to be able to help those who can't help themselves."
